header_summary:
Jeremy's discussion highlights proposed enhancements to Bitcoin's scripting capabilities, focusing on the introduction of *OP_EC_GENERATOR* for direct generator point G manipulation and a new operation, *OP_EC_LIFT_X_EVEN*, aimed at refining elliptic curve point operations. These adjustments seek to simplify the execution of operations involving the point at infinity and streamline the *OP_TWEAKADD* process by improving script composability and correcting inaccuracies in current implementations, thus enhancing Bitcoin's cryptographic processes. [Read more about the proposed Bitcoin scripting enhancements](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/CAO3Pvs-Cwj=5vJgBfDqZGtvmoYPMrpKYFAYHRb_EqJ5i0PG0cA@mail.gmail.com/T/#m47aca0b8c4a248d3be1637a936a32fbedd571068)

In another thread, Jeremy et al. explore various cryptographic techniques aiming to bolster the Bitcoin Improvement Proposal framework, including tweak reveal scripts, Proof-of-Signing-Order, delegation, target tweaks, and key reveal strategies. These discussions underscore the sophisticated advancement in cryptographic capabilities designed to heighten security, efficiency, and flexibility in Bitcoin's transaction verification and execution processes. [Explore the advanced cryptographic proposals for Bitcoin](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/bc9ff794-b11e-47bc-8840-55b2bae22cf0n@googlegroups.com/T/#m32b44c2b202d867818f4ea9fd3b9af50f3fd0ae2)

Taparoo provides an analysis of Bitcoin's potential to capture 50% of global wealth, leveraging principles from Michael Saylor's analysis and economic laws like Gresham's and Thiers'. This conversation delves into the economic theories underpinning Bitcoin's adoption trajectory, suggesting an eventual shift towards Bitcoin becoming a primary unit of account amidst hyperinflation scenarios. [Delve into the game-theoretic approach to Bitcoin's valuation](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/a-game-theoretic-approach-to-bitcoin-s-valuation-in-equilibrium/1547/2)

Bruno introduces **bitcoinfuzz**, a project dedicated to enhancing security in Bitcoin and the Lightning Network through differential fuzzing. This initiative has identified numerous bugs across various implementations, emphasizing the importance of rigorous testing in improving network protocols. With continued development and integration into platforms like OSS-Fuzz, **bitcoinfuzz** aims to bolster the ecosystem's resilience against vulnerabilities. [Learn more about the bitcoinfuzz project](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/the-state-of-bitcoinfuzz/1946)

Cmp_ancp addresses the concept of Miner Extractable Value (MEV) and its implications for Bitcoin, contrasting it with Monero to highlight the complexities of mining strategies and network security. The discussion also touches on the philosophical and technical aspects of transaction expiration proposals, suggesting alternative approaches to enhance Bitcoin's protocol without introducing new vulnerabilities. [Examine the debate around MEV and transaction expiration in Bitcoin](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/taking-a-second-look-at-op-expire/1945/3)

recent_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] Elliptic Curve Operations for Bitcoin Script
recent_posts.summary:
- The proposal suggests adding *OP_EC_LIFT_X_EVEN* to reverse *OP_EC_POINT_X_COORD* effects imprecisely.
- It introduces *OP_EC_GENERATOR* for direct generator point G stacking, aiding script composability.
- Modifications aim to streamline *OP_TWEAKADD* execution, enhancing elliptic curve operation accuracy in Bitcoin scripts.

recent_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] OP_TWEAKADD
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses enhancing the BIP framework with advanced cryptographic techniques.
- It mentions specific proposals like the introduction of tweak reveal scripts for better security.
- Key concepts include Proof-of-Signing-Order, delegation, target tweak, and key reveal strategy.

recent_posts.title: A Game-Theoretic Approach to Bitcoin’s Valuation in Equilibrium
recent_posts.summary:
- The discussion highlights Bitcoin's potential to hold 50% of global wealth, based on Saylor's principle.
- It explores Gresham's Law, predicting Bitcoin will be hoarded before becoming widely accepted currency.
- Thiers' law suggests Bitcoin will replace bad money post-hyperinflation, becoming a primary currency.

recent_posts.title: The state of bitcoinfuzz
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoinfuzz aims to enhance Bitcoin and Lightning Network security via differential fuzzing.
- It has identified over 35 bugs in projects including Bitcoin Core and LND.
- Future plans include expanding fuzzing capabilities and integrating into Google's OSS-Fuzz.

recent_posts.title: Taking a second look at OP_EXPIRE
recent_posts.summary:
- Miner Extractable Value (MEV) could cause miners to ignore transactions, risking expiration and fund loss.
- Comparing Bitcoin to Monero's mining strategies requires caution due to their distinct characteristics.
- Proposals for Bitcoin transaction expiration might be addressed without altering the consensus mechanism.

active_posts.title: A Post Quantum Migration Proposal
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal enhances Bitcoin's defense against quantum threats via post-quantum cryptography standards.
- It introduces a phased approach, including a new P2QRH output type and phases out old signatures.
- Aimed at coordinative adoption across stakeholders, the plan ensures Bitcoin's security against quantum computing.

active_posts.title: Introducing Hourglass
active_posts.summary:
- This proposal aims to stop mass P2PK funds liquidation with a clear solution.
- Detailed solution documentation is available on the project's GitHub repository.
- It's shared on the Bitcoin Development Mailing List for its relevance to Bitcoin's technical evolution.

active_posts.title: Workshops and Activation for CHECKTEMPLATEVERIFY and CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
active_posts.summary:
- A feedback request was made for Bitcoin soft fork proposals, targeting economic nodes by 5 March 2025.
- Debates among developers focus on technical preferences for Bitcoin's protocol enhancement.
- An increase in Bitcoin nodes using knots to 15% illustrates the evolving infrastructure dynamics.

active_posts.title: Sharing block templates
active_posts.summary:
- Recent years show a shift in Bitcoin mempool policies, including adoption of full RBF and spam filters.
- Compact block relay significantly reduces block propagation times, improving blockchain update speed.
- Alternatives like weak blocks and template sharing enhance network efficiency and privacy.

active_posts.title: Writing Simplicity Programs with SimplicityHL
active_posts.summary:
- Simplicity is a minimal design programming language for blockchain smart contracts, but hard to use.
- SimplicityHL, a higher-level language, was introduced to make Simplicity more accessible for developers.
- It enables complex contract features, like non-interactive fee bumping, illustrating its potential for smart contracts.

active_posts.title: Chain Code Delegation: Private Access Control for Bitcoin Keys
active_posts.summary:
- Jesse Posner developed Chain Code Delegation for collaborative custody, emphasizing privacy.
- This method limits custodian visibility, allowing transaction signing without full key access.
- It enhances security by confining risks to transactions custodians sign with received tweaks.

today_in_history_posts.title: "Compressed" headers stream
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin headers are highly important, condensed data with increasing demand.
- Optimizing block header transmission could save approximately 40% in bandwidth.
- OpenTimestamps and Electrum enhance lite-client sync and proofs without full nodes.

today_in_history_posts.title: BOLT 11, real time micro payments, and route redundancy
today_in_history_posts.summary:
